I'm so happy about this place. It's simple, neighborhoodie tapas restaurant that service only 3 to 4 dishes a night.I got confused and asked for a "menu" but upon seeing what locals order, we knew they keep things simple. Old Spainard men wearing Facebook shirts advertising the restaurant.Salad (tomato, red onion, small olives) 2 euroFried Sardines. 2 EuroSausage with bread. 2 euro.Keg of Wine - small glasses.  2 euros. Some small seating area but there is a bar area too.  Super busy at nights past 9pm.
